# netbox_region (Resource)

Manages a region in Netbox. Regions provide a hierarchical way to organize sites geographically, such as continents, countries, states, or cities.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "netbox_region" "test" {
  name = "Test Region"
  slug = "test-region"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the region.
- `slug` (String) URL-friendly identifier for the region. Must be unique and contain only lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores.

### Optional

- `custom_fields` (Attributes Set) Custom fields assigned to this resource. Custom fields must be defined in Netbox before use. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--custom_fields))
- `description` (String) Description of the region.
- `parent` (String) ID or slug of the parent region. Leave empty for top-level regions. This enables hierarchical organization of geographic areas.
- `tags` (Attributes Set) Tags assigned to this resource. Tags must already exist in Netbox. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--tags))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the region (assigned by Netbox).

<a id="nestedatt--custom_fields"></a>
### Nested Schema for `custom_fields`

Required:

- `name` (String) Name of the custom field.
- `type` (String) Type of the custom field (text, longtext, integer, boolean, date, url, json, select, multiselect, object, multiobject).
- `value` (String) Value of the custom field.


<a id="nestedatt--tags"></a>
### Nested Schema for `tags`

Required:

- `name` (String) Name of the existing tag.
- `slug` (String) Slug of the existing tag.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Regions can be imported by ID
terraform import netbox_region.test 123
```
